settings.title: About
settings.description_text:
We're building a better spice trade, equitably and deliciously.

We source India's freshest, heirloom, and single-origin spices, directly from our partner farms to bring you next level flavor and fragrance!

settings.title: Newsletter
settings.newsletter_text:
We write a pretty great newsletter.

Seasonal reading lists, highly cookable recipes, feelings-filled harvest reports, and lots more.

Plus, we hella respect your privacy.

settings.text:
Decolonizing your spices. 

We are a queer, WOC-led business here to put money, equity and power into the hands of small, organic spice farmers that are leading the way in sustainability, regenerative agriculture and truly delicious spices.

Proudly grown in India.

settings.homepage_newsletter_body: Briefly describe your newsletter and write a quick sentence about your commitment to not spamming your subscribers.

settings.title: Let's be email friends?
settings.exit_intent_body:
We write a pretty great newsletter.

First dibs on the latest spice harvests, seasonal reading lists, highly cookable recipes, and very emotional harvest reports! We do it all! 

Plus, we hella respect your privacy.

settings.title: Fresh
settings.subtitle: Guaranteed same-year harvest, milled every 3 months
settings.paragraph: versus powders that can be up to five years old, still sitting on a grocery store shelf. Our turmeric has a floral fragrance due to its freshness.

settings.title: Potent
settings.subtitle: 100% pure heirloom variety
settings.paragraph: versus conventional turmeric, made of a blend of multiple low-quality varieties. ½ tsp of our turmeric equals 1 tsp of conventional turmeric in flavor and strength.

settings.title: Sustainable
settings.subtitle: Organically farmed
settings.paragraph: versus industrial spice farming sprayed with chemicals, and grown for yield + storability. Our turmeric is grown for the best flavor + fragrance, and reverses soil depletion.

settings.title: Equitable
settings.subtitle: Directly traded and farmers paid up to 6x the commodity price
settings.paragraph: versus spices passed through several traders in an unjust supply chain before arriving to the consumer. Traditional spice trading pays farmers 2% or less of revenue.

settings.title: Fresh
settings.subtitle: Guaranteed same-year harvest
settings.paragraph: versus spices that can be up to five years old, still sitting on a grocery store shelf.

settings.title: Potent
settings.subtitle: 100% pure heirloom varieties
settings.paragraph: versus conventional spices, made of a blend of varieties chosen solely for yield and storability.

settings.title: Sustainable
settings.subtitle: Organically farmed
settings.paragraph: versus industrial spice farming sprayed with chemicals, and pesticides.

settings.title: EQUITABLE
settings.subtitle: Direct-trade, upto 10x premium
settings.paragraph: versus conventional supply chains with farmers getting less than 2% of the final revenue.

settings.yellow-text:
The original intent of colonial conquest of the Indian subcontinent was a desire for domination of the spice trade.

600+ years later, as a young woman born and raised in postcolonial Mumbai, working at the intersection of food and culture, I was slowly discovering that not much about that system had changed.

Farmers made no money, spices changed hands upwards of 10 times between farmer and consumer, and the final spice on the shelf was usually an old, dusty, and flavorless shadow of what it once was.
settings.orange-text:
Diaspora Co. was founded in 2017 to create a radically new, and equitable vision of the spice trade, decolonizing a commodity back into a seasonal crop, and a broken system into an equal exchange.

Beyond highlighting gorgeous, indigenous spice varieties, it's also about creating a business for us, by us. Complicating and deepening what “Made in India” means, and how we tell our own stories of freedom, struggle, and diaspora through food.
settings.pink-text:
Today, we work in close partnership with the Indian Council of Agricultural Research to identify and provide ongoing support to our partner farmers, all of whom are on the cutting edge of regenerative, and sustainable agriculture.

Mr. Chacko in Kerala developed his own heirloom cardamom variety! Mr. Kasaraneni in Andhra Pradesh taught himself organic farming via Youtube and WhatsApp, the first in his entire village to go chemical-free! Our partner farmers are our heroes.

The future of our food system is BIPOC-led, equitable AF, and decolonizing every step of the way. Get on board.

- Sana Javeri Kadri, Founder & CEO

settings.maintext:
We are here to put money, equity and power into the hands of Indian farmers, and to disrupt and decolonize an outdated commodity spice trading system.
What do we mean by decolonization? We mean creating a spice trade that redistributes power away from solely the trader and instead, empowers its farmers, its laborers and the earth.
settings.bottomtextleft: In cutting out all middle men, we hugely increase the amount of money we can pay our partner farms. It means we are able to work with much smaller farms who in a traditional model would have lacked the capital or resources to export or scale. Our focus is on flavor, sustainability and heirloom seed, so if a farmer matches those criteria, they can rest assured that they will have a long term partner in us.
settings.bottomtextright: In the commodity trading model several farmers crops are mixed together at every stage. Quality is assessed based on aesthetics (color and size) versus how it was grown, which seeds it was grown from, and how it tastes or smells. It means that the farmer has no agency or control over the price they receive, or the quality of the final product. We’re here to say that that system is no longer good enough- we all deserve better.
